intro: Conyza artemisioides, commonly known as goatweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features slender, branching stems covered with fine hairs and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has alternate, narrow, and often hairy leaves that are typically covered with a fine layer of white bloom. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in agricultural fields. Conyza artemisioides is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
